CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Prior information notice without call for competition
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 08C21

ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: NHS Cambridgeshire and Peterborough Clinical Commissioning Group

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: NHS Cambridgeshire and Peterborough Clinical Commissioning Group

TITLE.P: Children and Young People Mental Health Services in Cambridgeshire and Peterborough

SHORT_DESCR.P: Provision of mental health support services to children and young people aged 5 to 25 years old across Cambridgeshire and Peterborough. Current commissioning assumptions are for a new service model and contract to commence from July 2021 for a duration of 3 to 5 years with annual contract value circa GBP 950 000 (up to GBP 4 750 000 potential over 5 years).

Expressions of interest are invited from appropriately experienced and capable providers to commence an engagement with NHS Cambridgeshire and Peterborough Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG) to assist the CCG to develop its commissioning intentions for the future provision of mental health services for children and young people. Current commissioning assumptions are that the service is likely to involve a contract for 3 to 5 years with a value circa GBP 950 000 per year (up to GBP 4 750 000 over potential 5 years), commencing from July 2021. Engagement with interested providers will assist to inform the CCG as to the level of interest, what types of providers might be appropriate to become involved in delivering a future solution and what collaborative solutions might be possible to provide the very best care and support to this often vulnerable cohort of children and young people. The engagement will seek to explore and understand potential service delivery and commercial models, whilst seeking to facilitate provider collaborative solutions.
The CCG is keen to hear from all types of providers, including voluntary and community organisations (VCOs).
Importantly, the CCG is planning to host an on-line market engagement/provider workshop on 13 October 2020 (10am-1pm) and confirmation is invited from providers wishing to participate.

The current scope of services is delivered through a model which provides short term interventions for 5 to 25 year olds with mild to moderate needs through various approaches including triage, advice, signposting, 121 sessions, online resources and groups. Services include anxiety, bereavement, Autistic Spectrum Disorder, Low Mood, Resiliency, using CBT and IPTA approaches. Further information of the CCG’s requirements and intentions for this service, and a copy of the Market Engagement Questionnaire (MEQ) for your completion is available at www.contractsfinder.service.gov.uk/Notice/6ef0cf89-a3bd-41b2-9253-5c2326fa04a7. Whilst participation in this engagement exercise is not a mandatory requirement for participating in any potential future procurement, the level of responses received will assist to inform the CCG as to the level of interest from the market and will be used as evidence as to the appropriate process to award a contract and whether to undertake a competitive procurement.

To express your interest and to confirm 13th October workshop attendance, please complete and return the market engagement questionnaire (MEQ) by 12.00 noon, Monday 12 October 2020 by email to david_brownlow@nhs.net with the email subject heading ‘Market Engagement Response — Cambridgeshire and Peterborough Children and Young People Mental Health’.

Responses to this engagement will be helpful to the CCG which plans to engage further with those providers which do express an interest, which may also include sharing updates of the future service intentions as specifications and commercial assumptions become more clearly defined.

INFO_ADD.P: To express interest and confirm 13th October workshop attendance, complete/return the market engagement questionnaire by 12 p.m. Monday 12 October 2020 by email to david_brownlow@nhs.net with email subject heading ‘Market Engagement Response — Cambridgeshire and Peterborough Children and Young People Mental Health’. Docs available at www.contractsfinder.service.gov.uk/Notice/6ef0cf89-a3bd-41b2-9253-5c2326fa04a7
Further information about the service and a copy of the market engagement questionnaire is available FREE of charge from www.contractsfinder.service.gov.uk/Notice/6ef0cf89-a3bd-41b2-9253-5c2326fa04a7

Completion of the market engagement questionnaire (MEQ) is requested by 12.00 noon, Monday 12 October 2020, which is also the document to complete to confirm you interest to participate in an on-line market engagement scheduled for 10 a.m.-1 p.m. Tuesday 13 October 2020. Details of the event will be supplied to respondees.
